StochasticDFO.integrand_evaluations package

Submodules

StochasticDFO.integrand_evaluations.integrand_evaluations module

class IntegrandEvaluations(so)

Bases: object

Class for evaluating the sample average function and sample average difference function

so

Instance of class StochasticObjective

Type:

StochasticObjective object

params

Dictionary of parameters. The keys are decision vectors, sample-size, and integrand evaluations.

Type:

dict

integrand_eval(x)

Returns the integrand evaluations corresponding to decision- vector x if x is present. Otherwise, returns None

Parameters:

x (1D numpy array) – Decision-vector

Returns:

out – The integrand evaluations corresponding to decision- vector x if x is present. Otherwise, returns None

Return type:

Numpy array or None

sample_avg_diff(x, pert_pts, sample_size)

Calculates the sample average difference, i.e., hat f(x+y,N)-hat f(x,N).

Parameters:

  • x (1D numpy array) – Decision-vector

  • pert_pts (numpy array) – Perturbation points

  • sample_size (int) – Sample-size at x

Returns:

out – Sample average difference hat f(x+y,N)-hat f(x,N)

Return type:

1D numpy array of float

sample_avg_fn(x, sample_size)

Calculates the sample average function, i.e., hat f(x,N).

Parameters:

  • x (1D numpy array) – Decision-vector

  • sample_size (int) – Sample-size at x

Returns:

out – Sample average function hat f(x,N)

Return type:

float
